skill.name: web-artifacts-builder
skill.description: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern frontend web technologies (React, Tailwind CSS, shadcn/ui). Use for complex artifacts requiring state management, routing, or shadcn/ui components - not for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts.
skill.summary: Suite of tools for creating elaborate, multi-component claude.ai HTML artifacts using modern fronten...
skill.author: Anthropic

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill with standard build tooling scripts. No malicious code, network calls, or security vulnerabilities detected. Scripts perform standard npm/pnpm package management and bundling operations.

content.value_statement: Create sophisticated, production-ready Claude artifacts with React, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and 40+ pre-configured shadcn/ui components, all bundled into a single shareable HTML file.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + TypeScript + Vite projects with full shadcn/ui component library (40+ components)
Pre-configure Tailwind CSS with shadcn/ui theming system and CSS variables
Set up path aliases (@/) for clean imports
Auto-detect Node.js version and configure compatible Vite versions
Bundle entire React applications into single self-contained HTML files
Include all Radix UI dependencies and modern UI primitives
Support for forms, data visualization, animations, and complex state management
Generate artifacts compatible with claude.ai artifact viewer
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher to run the initialization and bundling scripts
Requires pnpm package manager (auto-installs if missing)
Not suitable for simple single-file HTML/JSX artifacts (use native artifact creation instead)
Projects must have index.html in root directory for bundling
Bundle size can be large due to React and component library inclusion
Cannot include server-side functionality or backend APIs in bundled artifacts

use_cases.title: Complex Form Applications
use_cases.description: Create multi-step forms with validation, conditional fields, file uploads, and rich UI using shadcn/ui Form, Input, Select, Calendar, and Dialog components.
use_cases.target_user: Developers building user onboarding flows or data collection tools

use_cases.title: Design System Prototypes
use_cases.description: Rapidly prototype design systems and component libraries using the full suite of shadcn/ui components with customizable theming.

use_cases.title: Educational Interactive Tools
use_cases.description: Build interactive learning tools, calculators, or visualizations with React state management and polished UI components.

output_examples.output: A polished, responsive pricing component using shadcn/ui Card, Switch, and Button components, bundled into a single HTML file with all styles and interactivity included

best_practices: Use this skill only for complex artifacts requiring multiple components, state management, or routing - not for simple HTML/JSX
Follow the design guidelines: avoid excessive centered layouts, purple gradients, uniform rounded corners, and overuse of Inter font
Leverage the pre-installed shadcn/ui components instead of building custom components from scratch
Test the bundled artifact before sharing to ensure all functionality works in the single-file format
Keep bundle sizes reasonable by only importing components you actually use
Use the @/ path alias for clean imports: import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
Take advantage of the included theming system with CSS variables for consistent styling
Defer testing until after presenting the artifact to reduce latency unless issues are suspected
anti_patterns: Using this skill for simple single-component artifacts that could be created directly in Claude
Bundling artifacts that require server-side functionality or external API calls at build time
Creating artifacts without an index.html entry point in the project root
Over-engineering simple UI needs with the full React + shadcn/ui stack
Copying component code instead of using the pre-installed shadcn/ui library
Testing artifacts upfront before showing them to the user (adds unnecessary latency)

faq.question: When should I use this skill versus creating a simple HTML artifact?
faq.answer: Use this skill for complex artifacts requiring React state management, multiple interactive components, routing, or the shadcn/ui component library. For simple single-file HTML/JSX with basic interactivity, use native Claude artifact creation.

faq.question: What components are included in the shadcn/ui library?
faq.answer: 40+ components including: accordion, alert, avatar, badge, button, calendar, card, carousel, checkbox, command, dialog, drawer, dropdown-menu, form, input, label, popover, progress, scroll-area, select, separator, sheet, slider, switch, table, tabs, textarea, toast, tooltip, and many more.

faq.question: Can I use external libraries or APIs in my artifact?
faq.answer: You can include additional npm packages during development, but the bundled artifact is self-contained. External APIs can be called client-side, but the artifact cannot include server-side functionality.

faq.question: How large are the bundled HTML files?
faq.answer: Bundle sizes vary but typically range from 500KB to 2MB depending on components used. React and the component library add baseline size, so this approach is best for complex artifacts where the functionality justifies the size.

faq.question: What Node.js version do I need?
faq.answer: Node.js 18 or higher is required. The skill auto-detects your Node version and pins compatible Vite versions (5.4.11 for Node 18, latest for Node 20+).

faq.question: Can I customize the theming and styling?
faq.answer: Yes, the setup includes a full Tailwind CSS configuration with shadcn/ui's CSS variable-based theming system. You can customize colors, radius, and other design tokens in tailwind.config.js and src/index.css.

permissions: File system access for creating project directories
Network access for npm package downloads
